name: Holiday Inn Express Syracuse Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got off the elevator on the 3rd floor and immediately smelled cigarette smoke. The first thought was that someone had just returned from the outside after having a smoke. Later on, when going out to dinner, smelled the same thing in the hall. Asked at front desk and it turns out there are 4 rooms on the 3rd floor that are not smoke free. After retuning from dinner and retiring to the room, there was the occasional whiff of smoke in the room. Turns out we were right next to one of the designated rooms.
reviews.title: non smokers - stay off the third floor

reviews.text: Who would have thought that a new hotel would even think of permitting smoking inside the building!
reviews.title: Acceptable for 1-night stay
Night One
reviews.text: That was not the only issue:
- The wall construction between rooms was poor. We could hear the folks in the next room through the wall as they carried on a normal conversation.
reviews.title: Not Quiet!

reviews.text: - In the morning at breakfast, the bagels and English muffins on the breakfast bar were stale. The attendant gave my wife attitude when she pointed this out to her.
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent customer service!

reviews.text: This hotel is new, clean and nice. Everything was great.
reviews.title: No Complaints Here

likes.disliked: — Busy area with no restaurants within walking distance

reviews.text: My only complaint is that it is on a busy street with no decent restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nothing stolen but some bewares

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights (Mar. 7 and 15) on either end of a Florida vacation. Unlike the reader below my car was intact when I returned however the lot was muddy and unsupervised. I also booked online at a rate of $108 and found out upon arrival this was not the park and fly rate so although I was staying two nights I still had to pay $159 for one of the nights to park. I should have called however felt ripped off for a muddy lot when I had booked two nights.
reviews.title: My hubcaps got stolen

likes.disliked: — parking lot is not secure, questionable location, walls are paper thin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely, granite bath, beautiful bedding. No noise except in the hall and not bad. The small indoor pool and lounge area were also spotless. The hot breakfast was free and good- pre-fab micro bacon was the exception.
reviews.title: No restaurant or bar, Hotel is just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport shuttle was another minor problem. They take your flight time when you check in and guaranteed transportation. When I checked in the morning I was told they were behind and reservations were off. Consequently I had to have a disagreement with a man who wanted to jump in front of us in line because it was his time to go. I told him it was 30 minutes after my time. Take this into account if it is a busy morning.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for I-81 Travelers

likes.disliked: — Unfinished exterior grounds due to recent construction.

reviews.text: Stayed at The Holiday Inn Express for Syracuse University Family Weekend. This is a pretty new hotel and generally attractive andcomfortable. Check-in was smooth, staff was accommodating in getting us a cot for our son, room was new and clean, lonuge area very nice. They offer a decent breakfast with a variety of options. Location was abit out of the way for going to SU (about a 10 min. drive), but right around the corner from the Syracuse Airport. A decent array of restaurants in the area, mostly fast food. A good value for the money.
reviews.title: Clean, New Hotel, Good Service, Good Value

reviews.text: Despite asking for a non smoking room, we were assured we were in a no smoking room but it reeked of smoke. The room was very small but functional for 2 adults and one young teen. The comforters were quite old and appeared dirty as did the curtains. There was however good parking and they had a bus to take you to the airport as well as the mall which was very convenient.
reviews.title: Value with no frills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying only one night and flying out the next day, thank goodness as it was not one that I would be interested in staying for longer than one night.
reviews.title: Great location for cross-border shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical Holiday Inn Express, without a hot tub.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: Had a very pleasant stay, as this location is up to the standard expected.
reviews.title: Would Never Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove from Ottawa to Syracuse and stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Express to do the "stay and fly". We saved $700 on the cost of our flights, flying US Airways from Syracuse, compared to flights from Ottawa. This hotel caters to travellers doing just what we did. The room rate was US $169 for a king room, so it was a good deal for us.
reviews.title: Good Park and Fly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM - The room was a good size and very clean. The bathroom was fine, good bath and shower. Bed was fairly comfortable. Wi-Fi Internet was free in the room. Not high-end accomodations, but hey, this is a Holiday Inn. I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD - The hotel provides a self-serve breakfast, which included coffee/tea/juice, muffins & bagels, cheese omelettes and bacon & sausage & biscuits. It was OK... but if you want a better breakfast, there is a Denny's within walking distance. We had lunch there on the way home.
reviews.title: Best last minute decision ever!

likes.liked: — The staff and the package components!

reviews.text: PARKING/SHUTTLE - The long-term parking is between the hotel and the road, which seemed a good idea, so the cars are visible from the road. It's not a paved parking lot - but it was dry so we were fine. The car was untouched when we got back. There is a free shuttle to the airport, and you can book whatever time you want. The shuttle van belongs to the hotel. Coming back, we took a taxi from the airport to hotel, and it cost US $14, which seemed a bit pricy, as it's a 5-minute drive.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever! Canadian Travellers Beware!

reviews.text: SERVICE - The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle driver was also friendly.
reviews.title: Hated this ghetto hotel!!!!!!!!!!!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Syracuse Airport Hotel
description: New Syracuse airport hotel offers comfort and convenience. Indulge yourself by staying at the new Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Syracuse near the Syracuse Hancock International Airport (SYR). Our convenient hotel is located right at the entrance of the airport to accommodate your travel needs. Families will love staying at our hotel in Syracuse, New York, situated near the intersection of Col. Eileen Collins Blvd. and South Bay Road. This location offers fast access to many local attractions including the Carousel Center Mall, the Museum of Science and Technology and the Landmark Theatre. Other nearby attractions include the Rosamond Gifford Zoo, Syracuse University, Oneida Lake, Iron-Girl Triathlon and historic Armory Square. Business travelers appreciate the accommodations provided at our Syracuse Airport hotel. Located at the entrance to the airport, this hotel also provides close proximity to local companies such as Lockheed Martin, Syracuse Research Corporation, Cooper Crouse-Hinds and Anheuser-Busch, Inc. In addition, we provide meeting space for up to 15 people as well as business services, which include a fax machine, copier, printer and free high-speed, wireless Internet access. While staying at our Syracuse hotel, enjoy our choice amenities that include an indoor pool, a fitness center and our complimentary hot breakfast bar. Book your reservations now to get our great hotel deals and rates.
